subject: Re: [junit] Counting junit test failures/errors
msgSnippet: ... Ah, I stand corrected if such is the case. I can see some value in deciding that certain specific tests are less important than others and it s okay if
messageBody:
On 8/25/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> > This feature was requested by users who do tests that are allowed to
> fail
> > for a certain threshold, such as sending packets on an unreliable
> network.
>
> It seems the context is different. The Original Poster appeared to be
> asking about failing a build only if, say, 5% of the suite's tests
> failed. That's quite a bit different from the feature you mention here,
> which would help with your example as well as statistical kinds of
> testing for randomness, that kind of thing.


Ah, I stand corrected if such is the case.

I can see some value in deciding that certain specific tests are "less
important" than others and it's okay if they go broken for a little while,
but I certainly don't understand how it could be acceptable to say "any 5%
of my entire test suite can fail"...

I would love to get a clarification from the original poster...

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
